Package org.semanticweb.vlog4j.graal

Class GraalToVLog4JModelConverter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.semanticweb.vlog4j.graal.GraalToVLog4JModelConverter
  • public final class GraalToVLog4JModelConverter
extends Object
    Utility class to convert Graal data structures into VLog4J data structures. Labels (ConjunctiveQuery.getLabel(), Rule.getLabel(), or Term.getLabel()) are not converted since VLog4J does not support them.
    Author:
    Adrian Bielefeldt

      • convertQuery

        public static GraalConjunctiveQueryToRule convertQuery​(String ruleHeadPredicateName,
                                                       fr.lirmm.graphik.graal.api.core.ConjunctiveQuery conjunctiveQuery)
        Converts a Graal ConjunctiveQuery into a GraalConjunctiveQueryToRule. Answering a Graal ConjunctiveQuery over a certain knowledge base is equivalent to adding a Rule to the knowledge base, prior to reasoning. The rule consists of the query literals as the body and a single PositiveLiteral with a new predicate containing all the query variables as the head. After the reasoning process, in which the rule is materialised, is completed, this rule head can then be used as a query PositiveLiteral to obtain the results of the Graal ConjunctiveQuery.

        WARNING: The supplied ruleHeadPredicateName will be used to create a Predicate containing all answer variables from the conjunctiveQuery. If a Predicate with the same name and arity is used elsewhere in the same program, the result will differ from the one expected from the Graal ConjunctiveQuery.

        Parameters:
        ruleHeadPredicateName - A name to create a program-unique predicate for the query PositiveLiteral.
        conjunctiveQuery - A Graal Query.
        Returns:
        A GraalConjunctiveQueryToRule equivalent to the conjunctiveQuery input.

      • convertRule
